qas.question: Who had a policy of condemning Athanasius?
What was Athanasius doing the next time an arrest was attempted?
Where did Athanasius flee to after this attempt?
What did he write during this time?
In which work did he refer to Constantius as a precursor of the Antichrist?
Who had a policy of agreeing with Athanasius?
What was Athanasius doing the first time an arrest was attempted?
Where did Athanasius flee to before this attempt?
What did he paint during this time?

context: Constantius, renewing his previous policies favoring <a0_0>the <b5_0>Arians<b5_0/><a0_0/>, banished Athanasius from Alexandria once again. This was followed, in 356, by an attempt to arrest Athanasius during <a1_0>a <b6_0>vigil service<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Athanasius fled to <a2_0><b7_0>Upper Egypt<b7_0/><a2_0/>, where he stayed in several monasteries and other houses. During this period, Athanasius completed his work <a3_0><b8_0>Four Orations against the Arians<b8_0/><a3_0/> and defended his own recent conduct in the Apology to Constantius and Apology for His Flight. Constantius's persistence in his opposition to Athanasius, combined with reports Athanasius received about the persecution of non-Arians by the new Arian bishop George of Laodicea, prompted Athanasius to write his more emotional <a4_0>History of the Arians<a4_0/>, in which he described Constantius as a precursor of the Antichrist.
